KnowledgeBase.Title: iadd
KnowledgeBase.RelatedFunctions: addi divi modi muli subi isub imul idiv imod

Function.Description: The iadd function is a built-in function that adds integer operands and returns an integer value.

Brief.Overview: The iadd function is a built-in function that adds integer operands and returns an integer value. The operands are not checked and are not coerced.
Brief.Usage: The iadd built-in function is a simple but very fast integer addition function. Use the iadd function for highly optimized integer addition. An alternate function, addi, will take any numeric operand and will perform type conversion before adding and returns an integer result, but is much slower.

Syntax.Return: Returns an Integer sum of all of the operands.
